Title: the tangible affection proof

Scene: Stuart That actually sounds kind of nice.
Penny: You’ll never believe what happened to me at work today.
This old guy was choking on his food, and I saved his life.
No. I said, oh, my God, I think that old guy’s choking, and then one of the busboys Heimlich’ed him.
Yeah, that was the point of the story.
Um, I think so. Why?
Oh, right. Yeah, we can do something.
No, I’m into it, I’m into it. Just, there’s so much pressure to make the night special, and it never works out.
You know, sometimes I think I’ve made you so much cooler than you used to be, and then you go and do that.
This place is really beautiful.
Hey.
No problem. We just sat down.
Is everything okay?
Oh, son of a bitch.
Nothing. Nothing.
It’s just this guy I used to date.
Until he cheated on me with my friend Gretchen, who’s here with him now.
And it looks like she lost a lot of weight, damn it.
No, you’re totally right. She could be skinny ’cause she’s dying.
You know what, screw them. Our night is going to be way more special than theirs.
What? (Penny’s ex is proposing to Gretchen) Oh, you got to be kidding me.
Get up.
Oh, I can’t believe he’s going to marry the girl he cheated on me with.
What, so I’m the wrong person? Maybe you want to be with Gretchen, too.
Yes, absolutely. Now they’re doing that phony link-arm-drink thingy. I totally taught him that.
Yeah, yeah, I know.
Oh, come on, don’t make this about you.
Yeah, well, whatever, okay? I told you, Valentine’s Day sucks.
What?
Night.
Yeah, I know. I’m a total bitch.
Well, I am.
I don’t know. Maybe ’cause things are going so well between us lately and I’ve been really happy.
Obviously, I have some commitment issues.

As long as things keep going great between us, you’ll keep asking me to marry you, and eventually I’m gonna end up saying yes, and then we’re gonna be married forever, and the whole thing just freaks me out.
What, what do you mean? Are you breaking up with me?
Really?
Yeah, you got it.
Okay. You know what? This might be the wine talking, but I have a very important question to ask you.
Leonard Hofstadter?
Will you be my valentine?
Leonard: Hmm?
You’re kidding. Did you Heimlich him?
You’re a hero.
Oh, yeah, speaking of work, do you know if you have Thursday night off?
What do you mean, why? It’s Valentine’s Day.
You could be a little more into it.
Okay, well, this time it’s going to be different. Because I am like a romance ninja. You don’t see it coming, and then bam, romance, watch out, hearts, kisses, love, ooh-ya!
Hey, you coming to lunch?
What you looking at?
You can’t find a card that says that?
Oh, that’s cool.
From her micro-husband. That is amazing. How long did this take you?
Oh, wow.
Oh, I’m going to take her to a nice restaurant for dinner.
Want to come to dinner with us?
Waugh, romance ninja.
Mmm, would you like some wine?
Uh, where what is?
Trying to have a magical night here, guys.
What?
No, tell me.
Oh.
You’re kidding.
I know it’s not ideal, but don’t let them ruin our night.
That’s the spirit.
Yeah.
Two can play this game. Penny…
All right.
Isn’t it kind of nice? I mean, he was with the wrong person, and now he found the right person.
You know what? Why don’t we just forget about them and enjoy our Valentine’s Day?
I thought we were letting it go.
Um, it did end happy for you. You’re here with me.
Okay, this is getting a little hard to not take personally.
Oh, I’m not. It’s about you.
This one does, and you’re the reason why.
Yep. You know what? That was pretty crappy of you. I mean, all I wanted to do was give you a great night, and it’s like you-you went out of your way to destroy it.
I’m not saying that.
Fine, you win. You’re a bitch. Why couldn’t we just have a nice time?
Okay, you’re gonna have to make a lot more sense than that.
Glaringly obvious. Go on.
Okay. I know I propose a lot. So how about this? I promise I will never ask you to marry me again.
No. No, no, no, no. But if someday you decide you want to get married, you have to propose to me.
Yes. It’s all on you. But I got to tell you, when the time comes, I want the whole nine yards. I want you down on one knee, flowers, I want to be swept off my feet.
And I’m cool with surprises. But nothing on a Jumbotron. I don’t want to cry on a big screen like that.
You do?
Yes?
Sorry. Maybe next year. I’m just kidding. Romance ninja. Let’s have sex. Waugh!
Sheldon: So, in conclusion, I believe the painful sensation felt after passing a meal of spicy chillies is proof that the rectum does possess the sense of taste.
Oh, you caught that, did you?
Ah, Alex, excellent. I have a research problem that I believe you can help with.
Oh, no, no. That’s not going to happen, no. What I need you to do is find a Valentine’s gift for my girlfriend.

Well, I guess those chaps will have to have someone else buy their girlfriends presents. Now, here is, let’s see, this is, this is about two thousand dollars, um, I think she likes monkeys and the colour grey. Contribute to my work. Ah, kids say the darnedest things.
Okay. Amy will be here shortly, expecting the perfect Valentine’s gift, so, you’re up kid. Dazzle me. Go.

Now, see, I never would have thought to do that. Clearly, I made a good choice farming this out to you. But I am telling you, Amy hit the boyfriend jackpot. Anyway, my socks are on. Let’s knock them off.
Now, Amy already has a real harp. And it can play any song. What are you trying to pull here?
Next.
Mmm.
But she’s got Google Maps on her phone.
Well, I hope it’s with a third good option, because these first two, buh.
Wow. Oh, this is truly remarkable.
I think I’ll keep it for myself.
It’s too late. I call dibs.
Hello.
Okay. Shall we go to dinner?
Yes, and as you know, I planned to pretend to enjoy it. I’ve been working on this facial expression all day.
What is that?
Really?
More than anything.
Well, I don’t know what to say. This is the most thoughtful gift that anyone’s ever given me. And that’s including an amazing gift that I gave myself earlier today.
No. No, after everything you didn’t do for me tonight, I want you to have it.
Read it.
At the bottom.
Well, I thought, if I have a stroke or a kidney stone, who would I want to share that with?
It’s like you said, you’re my girlfriend.
Yeah. Okay. Stop ruining Valentine’s Day and order my pizza.
Amy: I concur, but you changed the subject. What are we doing for Valentine’s Day?
Hang on. As you know, I had planned a traditional evening of romance and gifts.
And I appreciate your effort, but upon contemplation, I decided I was being selfish. So, I cancelled our dinner reservations and came up with an even better way to celebrate Valentine’s Day.
By doing none of it. No dinner, no romance, no gifts. We stay here, order a pizza and watch one of your beloved Star War Trek things.
Well, that’s what you’d love, isn’t it?
Well, then, that’s what we’re going to do.
I’m your girlfriend. That’s my job. And I know gift-giving puts a lot of pressure on you, so whatever you got me, you can return.
Sheldon Cooper, Caltech University employee information?
In case of emergency, please contact… Amy Farrah Fowler. And there’s my phone number. This is the most beautiful gift you could’ve ever given me.

Hello? Another medical emergency? What’s wrong with him now? I seriously doubt he was bitten by a Chinese bird spider. How exactly does a bump feel Asian? Just put him on the phone. Sheldon, I am not driving over there again. Because I drove over there yesterday for a brain tumour that turned out to be an ice cream headache. Yes, I still want to be your emergency contact. Yes, you can eat your ice cream too fast and also have a brain tumour. I’m on my way. Brain tumour would explain a lot.
Howard (on phone): Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay! Okay.
Raj: Hey, Stuart, you got anything going on for Valentine’s Day?
Oh, well, I was going to spend the night with my special little lady, but, uh, she got worms, and then I had to take her to the vet.
Well, uh, how about you keep the store open late, and we throw a party for all the people who don’t have dates?
Yeah, the theme will be that the greatest love a man can have is the love he has with himself.
It’s nice that all the people who are lonely on Valentine’s Day can come here tonight and be together.
Except on a date with anybody.
You know, you and I have so much fun hanging out. If you were a girl, all our problems would be solved.
Oh, yeah, think about it. We’d hang out, we’d read comic books, we’d see movies. It’d be like the best relationship ever.
Then I’d take you home, slip off your little black dress and just pile-drive you into oblivion.
We’re glad you could make it.
What is it about this holiday that makes people so unhappy?

I got to tell you, we’ve got to stop beating ourselves up like this. Excuse me, everybody. Can I have your attention, please? We’re all here tonight because we have no one to be with. But that doesn’t make us mutants. The only mutants here are in these comic books. We’ve got to stop defining our self-worth by whether or not we’re in a relationship. You know what I see when I look around? I see a room full of great people. So let’s give ourselves a break. We are a community, and as long as we have each other, we’re never truly alone.
Thank you. Uh, would you like to, uh, get a cup, a cup of coffee or…?
Howard: Bernie’s a little cranky since she’s been working, like, 17 hours a day. And I’ve got a lot on my plate, too, because I’ve been busting my tail playing Assassin’s Creed.
Yeah, one second. Come here. I want to show you something.
Well, I was trying to come up with something really romantic to give Bernadette for Valentine’s Day since she’s been such a pain in the ass.
Check it out. I used the atomic force microscope in the material science lab and wrote our initials in a heart one one-thousandth the size of a grain of sand.
A micro-valentine for a microbiologist.
Mmm, about twelve hours. I pulled an all-nighter.
Yeah, I know, it really took a bite out of my video game time. What are you and Penny doing?
Oh, that’s not bad, but as far as romance goes, I think my gift hits it right out of… (Bumps into chair and drops the slide)
Yes, please.
Sorry we’re late.
Terrific. Couldn’t be better.
Look, we can still have a nice night. Just tell me where it is.
She hid my Xbox like I’m a child. Yeah, and my mom got me that for my birthday, so if you don’t give it back, I’m telling.
I said I’m sorry.
I told you, turn them inside out.
Yeah, maybe tonight. But a year from now, he’ll be crawling under the sink looking for his Xbox. Well, he will.
Me, too. How about we blow off dessert, go home early, I’ll do that laundry.
I love you.
So where’d you hide it?
Damn it, it’s in the washing machine.
Stuart: Not really. Other than hiding all the sharp objects around here and white-knuckling it till morning. What do you got going on?
There must be something we can do.
That’s good. Or maybe something a little less hand in the pants.
Yeah, I’m really looking forward to it. In fact, there’s no place I would rather be than here.
I know. I hate myself most of the time, but tonight’s the night I know everyone else does, too.
Alex: Oh, Dr. Cooper, thank you. I’ve been waiting for an opportunity to contribute to your scientific work.
You realize I passed up an opportunity to work at Fermilab to take this job with you.
Okay, I think I have some really great choices. I went on Amy’s Facebook page and read up on her interests.
Well, um, I know she loves playing the harp, so I found this beautiful music box that plays one of her favourite songs.
No, I just thought it would be…
Okay. Um, I know she’s a fan of The Canterbury Tales.
So I found this cool map that illustrates the character’s journey through England. I thought we could put it in a really nice frame.
I don’t know how to respond to that.

Okay. Well, uh, luckily, I saved the best for last. Since Amy’s a neuroscientist, I did some research and found out that Santiago Ramon y Cajal, the father of modern neuroscience, did lots of hand drawings of brain cells. And I managed to find this signed print.
Bernadette: Yeah, fill her up. I’ll tell you when to stop.
Maybe if you did what you said you were going to do, I’d tell you.

I’ve been working late every night. All I asked was that he clean the apartment and do one load of laundry. But did he do it? No. He just kept on playing that stupid game. You like pushing buttons so much, try pushing them on the washing machine.
Sorry doesn’t clean my underpants, buddy.
And I told you to bite me.
You know, compared to them, I’m feeling pretty good about us.
Gretchen: Oh, my God, yes. Of course I’ll marry you.
Penny: We were: it’s just, it’s not fair, okay? They’re bad people. It’s not supposed to end happy for them, it’s supposed to end happy for me.
Nerdy guy: Thank you, guys, for doing this.
Usually I spend Valentine’s Day sad and alone. This year, I’m just sad.
Girl: That was cool. What you said.

Wow. Oh, this is truly remarkable.
I think I’ll keep it for myself.
It’s too late. I call dibs.
No problem. We just sat down.
Mmm, would you like some wine?
Yeah, fill her up. I’ll tell you when to stop.
Look, we can still have a nice night. Just tell me where it is.
Maybe if you did what you said you were going to do, I’d tell you.
She hid my Xbox like I’m a child. Yeah, and my mom got me that for my birthday, so if you don’t give it back, I’m telling.

It’s just this guy I used to date.

And it looks like she lost a lot of weight, damn it.

Yeah, I’m really looking forward to it. In fact, there’s no place I would rather be than here.
Except on a date with anybody.

Yes, absolutely. Now they’re doing that phony link-arm-drink thingy. I totally taught him that.
I thought we were letting it go.
it’s just, it’s not fair, okay? They’re bad people. It’s not supposed to end happy for them, it’s supposed to end happy for me.
Um, it did end happy for you. You’re here with me.
Okay, this is getting a little hard to not take personally.
Oh, come on, don’t make this about you.
Oh, I’m not. It’s about you.
Yeah, well, whatever, okay? I told you, Valentine’s Day sucks.
This one does, and you’re the reason why.
You know, compared to them, I’m feeling pretty good about us.
Me, too. How about we blow off dessert, go home early, I’ll do that laundry.
Damn it, it’s in the washing machine.
Okay. Shall we go to dinner?
Hang on. As you know, I had planned a traditional evening of romance and gifts.

And I appreciate your effort, but upon contemplation, I decided I was being selfish. So, I cancelled our dinner reservations and came up with an even better way to celebrate Valentine’s Day.
By doing none of it. No dinner, no romance, no gifts. We stay here, order a pizza and watch one of your beloved Star War Trek things.
Well, that’s what you’d love, isn’t it?
Well, then, that’s what we’re going to do.
Well, I don’t know what to say. This is the most thoughtful gift that anyone’s ever given me. And that’s including an amazing gift that I gave myself earlier today.
I’m your girlfriend. That’s my job. And I know gift-giving puts a lot of pressure on you, so whatever you got me, you can return.
No. No, after everything you didn’t do for me tonight, I want you to have it.
Sheldon Cooper, Caltech University employee information?
In case of emergency, please contact… Amy Farrah Fowler. And there’s my phone number. This is the most beautiful gift you could’ve ever given me.
Well, I thought, if I have a stroke or a kidney stone, who would I want to share that with?
It’s like you said, you’re my girlfriend.
Yeah. Okay. Stop ruining Valentine’s Day and order my pizza.
Yep. You know what? That was pretty crappy of you. I mean, all I wanted to do was give you a great night, and it’s like you-you went out of your way to destroy it.
Yeah, I know. I’m a total bitch.
Fine, you win. You’re a bitch. Why couldn’t we just have a nice time?
I don’t know. Maybe ’cause things are going so well between us lately and I’ve been really happy.
Okay, you’re gonna have to make a lot more sense than that.
Obviously, I have some commitment issues.

As long as things keep going great between us, you’ll keep asking me to marry you, and eventually I’m gonna end up saying yes, and then we’re gonna be married forever, and the whole thing just freaks me out.
Okay. I know I propose a lot. So how about this? I promise I will never ask you to marry me again.
What, what do you mean? Are you breaking up with me?
No. No, no, no, no. But if someday you decide you want to get married, you have to propose to me.

We’re glad you could make it.

Sheldon, I am not driving over there again. Because I drove over there yesterday for a brain tumour that turned out to be an ice cream headache. Yes, I still want to be your emergency contact. Yes, you can eat your ice cream too fast and also have a brain tumour. I’m on my way. Brain tumour would explain a lot.
